thread.title: June Brown reveals 'rivalry' with EastEnders co-star Gretchen Franklin | Metro News
thread.title_full: June Brown reveals 'rivalry' with EastEnders co-star Gretchen Franklin | Metro News

author: Sarah Deen For Metro.Co.Uk
title: June Brown reveals 'rivalry' with EastEnders co-star Gretchen Franklin | Metro News
text:
Sarah Deen for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 15 Feb 2017 6:00 am (Picture: BBC) 
June Brown has revealed her off screen ‘rivalry’ with her EastEnders co-star Gretchen Franklin. Corrie cast wish June Brown a happy 90th by sharing clip from her time on cobbles 
June, who plays Dot Cotton, shared many wonderful scenes with Gretchen as Ethel Skinner. 
On our screens Dot and Ethel were close pals – as well as sparring partners – and Ethel’s death episode, which saw Dot help her to die, was watched by millions and will go down as one of the most iconic moments soap history. 
But in a special programme filmed for her 90th birthday, June says she and Gretchen, who died in 2005, didn’t start off as friends. 
June said: ‘I heard that how she looked upon me – a new character arriving – was as a rival. Gretchen, who played Ethel Skinner died in 2005 (Picture: BBC) 
‘We had a scene together in the pub and Wendy [Richards – who played Pauline] said to her, “when you and June are together on the screen, you’re like two bulls”, and Gretchen thought “oh, I can work with her”. 
‘From that moment on she worked with me. We always concentrated on each other, that was the secret.
